title: [BUG] API error when calling log_params with a dict containing an empty string as value

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

1.27.0

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux / MacOS
- **Python version**: 3.10.5
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

Using the last version of mlflow (and Python client), when I try to log params in a run using the log_params method (and a dict in argument), I got an API error if a value of my dict is an empty string.

The following code works : `mlflow.log_param('test', '')`
But this one not : `mlflow.log_params({'test': ''})`

### Tracking information

MLflow version: 1.27.0

tracking uri and artifact uri are sensitive informations

### Code to reproduce issue

```python
mlflow.log_params({'test': ''})
```

### Other info / logs

```python-traceback
{RestException}INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: Invalid value [{'key': 'test', 'value': ''}] for parameter 'params' supplied. Hint: Value was of type 'list'. See the API docs for more information about request parameters.
```

### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/pipelines`: Pipelines, Pipeline APIs, Pipeline configs, Pipeline Templates
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [X] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
